page.title: 18ARRETON SCHOOL
page.content: Arreton School was established in 1833. The original classroom is stone built and the school house is a mixture of stone and brick. The second classroom is brick built and the hall is a timber building. The 43 children at present on roll are aged between 4 and 9. There is one head teacher, one class teacher and a half_time teacher. The school catchment area encompasses the two villages of Arreton and Merston and the surrounding areas of Hale Common, Bathingbourne, Downend and Blackwater. The school meals are delivered from the central canteen at Nine Acres school, Newport.
